alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, southwestern Fayette and southeastern Shelby Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eudora, or near Hernando, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Memphis, Byhalia, Walls, Lake Cormorant, Eudora, Lewisburg, Lynchburg, Piperton, Rossville, Coal Oil Corner, Cayce, Trinity, Frees Corners and Cedarview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee.
